title: [K-12] Mastering Droplet Microfluidics Design Using Reinforcement Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary Fluid Mechanics and Programming Concepts
context.additional_context: Enhancing competency in integrated microfluidic device design for practical application

learning_goals: Learners can propose microfluidic network designs meeting specified functional requirements using reinforcement learning algorithms
Learners can simulate the implementation of an integrated chip design for complex tasks such as droplet alignment/sorting
Learners can derive optimized network structures compared to traditional genetic algorithms (GA) by applying RL-based decision-making processes
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
